title: Seifert–Van Kampen theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Seifert–Van Kampen theorem of algebraic topology (named after Herbert Seifert and Egbert van Kampen), sometimes just called Van Kampen's theorem,  expresses the structure of the fundamental group of a topological space X {\displaystyle X} in terms of the fundamental groups of two open, path-connected subspaces that cover X {\displaystyle X} . It can therefore be used for computations of the fundamental group of spaces that are constructed out of simpler ones.
